body:
r? @brson

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)

This is WIP for two reasons:
1. Not yet passing tests on Windows; it's close.
2. It still uses `old_io` in a few places, since I didn't want to duplicate work in the `std::fs` PR.
I added a few comments about the implementation details themselves, but we can also continue to hammer those out later, I think that the API is the more important part to land as part of this PR.
Also, this is now using the new IO traits, etc, since it's rebased over `std::fs`. It passes tests on mac os, and compiles on Windows; I should know whether it passes Windows tests shortly.
@alexcrichton Note, this is failing tests on Windows, so don't send it to bors just yet. (But modulo figuring out the problem, it's otherwise ready for a second review.)
Just a few more minor nits, but otherwise r=me

@alexcrichton Updated, removing `FileDesc` from Windows and introducing `pipe2` modules for all platforms. At the moment, `pipe2` covers only `AnonPipe` but we can later migrate names pipes/domain sockets.

I also moved `read`/`write` into `Handle` for Windows, and made `read` deal with `BrokenPipe` correctly.
@alexcrichton I have also addressed all of your comments, and tidied up a few names (the fields of `Output`, mostly).
Just a few last nits, but otherwise looks good to go to me. r=me with nits addressed
:hourglass: Testing commit cc408a0 with merge c748266...
